Key Match Events: Denmark's 0-0 draw with Serbia at the Allianz Arena was a crucial result for the Scandinavian side, securing them a last-16 place and potentially top spot in Group C.
Pre-Game Insights: Denmark manager Kasper Hjulmand is expecting to have all 26 players at his disposal for the match against Serbia.

The Scandinavian side sit second in the section with two points to their name and will be guaranteed a last-16 place - and potentially top spot - if they win, while a draw will also suffice if Slovenia lose to England.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Denmark's predicted starting lineup includes Kasper Schmeichel, Joachim Andersen, Andreas Christensen, and Jannik Vestergaard in defense.
Morten Hjulmand and Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg are expected to start behind Christian Eriksen, who is set to make an unrivalled 133rd appearance for the Danish men's team.
Others: The article provides an in-depth look at Denmark's predicted lineup and the team's chances of securing a last-16 place in Group C.
